config.description: Reference to the configuration for the Broker.

attributes.description: Map of CloudEvents attributes used for filtering events.

subscriber.description: the destination that should receive events.

uri.description: the target URI or, if ref is provided, a relative URI reference that will be combined with ref to produce a target URI.

ceOverrides.description: Defines overrides to control modifications of the event sent to the sink.

replicationFactor.description: Replication factor of a Kafka topic.

subscribers.description: The list of subscribers that have expressed interest in receiving events from this channel.

iter8.tools.v1alpha1.ExperimentSpec.description: ExperimentSpec defines the desired state of Experiment

successCriteria.description: List of criteria for assessing the candidate version

items.description: SuccessCriterion specifies the criteria for an experiment to succeed

metricName.description: Name of the metric to which the criterion applies. Options:

min_max.description: Minimum and maximum values of the metric

max.description: Max maximum possible value of the metric

min.description: Min minimum possible value of the metric

sampleSize.description: Minimum number of data points required to make a decision based on this criterion; If not specified, the default value is 10

stopOnFailure.description: Indicates whether or not the experiment must finish if this criterion is not satisfied; defaults to false

toleranceType.description: Tolerance type. Options: "delta": compares the candidate against the baseline version with respect to the metric; "threshold": checks the candidate with respect to the metric

assessment.description: Assessment is a flag to terminate experiment with action

cleanup.description: CleanUp is a flag to determine the action to take at the end of experiment

routingReference.description: RoutingReference provides references to routing rules set by users

fieldPath.description: If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2]. For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like: "spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of referencing a part of an object. TODO: this design is not final and this field is subject to change in the future.

kind.description: Kind of the referent. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resourceVersion.description: Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids

targetService.description: TargetService is a reference to an object to use as target service

baseline.description: Baseline tells the name of baseline

candidate.description: Candidate tells the name of candidate

fieldPath.description: If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2]. For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like: "spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of referencing a part of an object. TODO: this design is not final and this field is subject to change in the future.

kind.description: Kind of the referent. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resourceVersion.description: Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: UID of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids

trafficControl.description: TrafficControl defines parameters for controlling the traffic

confidence.description: The required confidence in the recommeded traffic split. Defaults to 0.95

interval.description: Interval is the time in second before the next increment. Default is 1mn

maxIterations.description: Maximum number of iterations for this experiment. Default to 100.

maxTrafficPercentage.description: MaxTrafficPercentage is the maximum traffic ratio to send to the candidate. Default is 50

onSuccess.description: Determines how the traffic must be split at the end of the experiment; options: "baseline": all traffic goes to the baseline version; "candidate": all traffic goes to the candidate version; "both": traffic is split across baseline and candidate. Defaults to “candidate”

strategy.description: Strategy is the strategy used for experiment. Options: "check_and_increment": get decision on traffic increament from analytics "increment_without_check": increase traffic each interval without calling analytics

trafficStepSize.description: TrafficStepSize is the traffic increment per interval. Default is 2.0

status.description: ExperimentStatus defines the observed state of Experiment

analysisState.description: AnalysisState is the last analysis state

assessment.description: AssessmentSummary returned by the last analyis

abort_experiment.description: Indicates whether or not the experiment must be aborted based on the success criteria

all_success_criteria_met.description: Indicates whether or not all success criteria for assessing the candidate version have been met

conclusions.description: Overall summary based on all success criteria

success_criteria.description: The list of status for all success criteria applied

items.description: SuccessCriterionStatus contains assessment for a specific success criteria

abort_experiment.description: Indicates whether or not the experiment must be aborted on the basis of the criterion for this metric

conclusions.description: Assessment of this success criteria in plain English

metric_name.description: Name of the metric to which the criterion applies example: iter8_latency

success_criteria_met.description: Indicates whether or not the success criterion for the corresponding metric has been met

conditions.description: Conditions the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

items.description: Conditions defines a readiness condition for a Knative resource. See: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#typical-status-properties

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the last time the condition transitioned from one status to another. We use VolatileTime in place of metav1.Time to exclude this from creating equality.Semantic differences (all other things held constant).

message.description: A human readable message indicating details about the transition.

reason.description: The reason for the condition's last transition.

severity.description: Severity with which to treat failures of this type of condition. When this is not specified, it defaults to Error.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

currentIteration.description: CurrentIteration is the current iteration number

endTimestamp.description: EndTimestamp is the timestamp when experiment completes

grafanaURL.description: GrafanaURL is the url to the Grafana Dashboard

lastIncrementTime.description: LastIncrementTime is the last time the traffic has been incremented

message.description: Message specifies message to show in the kubectl printer

observedGeneration.description: ObservedGeneration is the 'Generation' of the Service that was last processed by the controller.

phase.description: Phase marks the Phase the experiment is at

startTimestamp.description: StartTimestamp is the timestamp when the experiment starts

trafficSplitPercentage.description: TrafficSplit tells the current traffic spliting between baseline and candidate

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.

status.description: Most recently observed status. This data may not be up to date. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status
